name: kyleen
tweet: Thank you #dreamteam pic.twitter.com/xOeLRXXpaB

name: Walker44
tweet: The Governors have been doing a great job! I just hope Trump doesn't step into this and set everything back! He didn't want to take the lead in closing the states but he wants the credit for reopening them!

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: And I’m excited that @MassGovernor is also joining this regional effort to safely reopen the economy. Together, we’re going to get people back to work as soon as possible.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’re lucky enough to be in the position to give at this time, the Foundation is also accepting donations at  http://RIFoundation.org/RIEducation .

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also want to note that @FamilyServiceRI is providing delivery of cleaning supplies and food for some of our most vulnerable Rhode Islanders. If you'd like to donate to their effort, you can do so by texting BESAFE to 44321 or going to  http://familyserviceri.org .

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’re interested in supporting their efforts, you can make a donation on each of their websites.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thank you also to Books Are Wings, Reach Out and Read, RI Center for the Book, and RI Festival of Children’s Books and Authors for delivering more than 6,000 books to schools and meal sites across the state. Thousands more are set to be delivered by the end of the month.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thank you to the public libraries across RI that have been working to provide online resources & virtual story times to our families despite their buildings being closed to the public. Some public library locations are offering curbside pickup to families.  https://www.ride.ri.gov/InsideRIDE/AdditionalInformation/AprilReadingChallenge.aspx …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m excited to announce that at the end of the month, Barnes & Noble will be donating a set of new books to the early childhood center, elementary school, middle school, and high school with the most participation in the challenge.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Continue to log your minutes and post pictures and videos of yourself reading with the hashtag #RIReadsAtHome.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I recently announced the April Reading Challenge for all students in RI. We’re asking you to read every single day whether you’re in Pre-K or finishing up your senior year of high school. As of today, more than 3,500 students have logged more than 150,000 minutes of reading.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We know holidays can be a difficult time if you don’t have a strong support system, and it’s even more difficult during a time like this. Remember if you’re struggling, please call @BHLinkRI at 401-414-LINK.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I'm also asking you to refrain from bringing gifts, as we know this virus lives on surfaces. These rules are in place because we care, and we need you to hang in there a little longer with these restrictions.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to make a special plea to those who have loved ones in nursing homes or assisted living facilities. I know how hard it is to not see family, but you cannot go visit family members in these settings this weekend.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Tomorrow is Easter, and for many of us, it’s a weekend where we’re used to celebrating with our families. I know it might be tempting to think about whether you can have a larger gathering for a meal or go visit family you haven’t seen in weeks. Don't do it.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We need everyone to look out for each other. It’s more important than ever that we check in on each other. Call your neighbors, friends and family members. Ask them how they’re doing. Your call might make all the difference.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: While courts are closed for non-essential business, they are open for all domestic violence matters.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: .@ricadv and all of its member agencies are open. Domestic violence shelters are open. These are critical services, and their confidential hotline is available 24/7 at 1-800-494-8100.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Earlier this week, I got a question about what we’re doing to help deal with domestic violence through this crisis. I want you to know I have a team that’s working on this, and remind everyone of the resources that are available right now:

name: RIDeptEd
tweet: Thank you, Governor! 🦁

name: kyleen
tweet: Thank you #dreamteam pic.twitter.com/xOeLRXXpaB

tweet: Continue to log your minutes and post pictures and videos of yourself reading with the hashtag #RIReadsAtHome.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We know holidays can be a difficult time if you don’t have a strong support system, and it’s even more difficult during a time like this. Remember if you’re struggling, please call @BHLinkRI at 401-414-LINK.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I'm also asking you to refrain from bringing gifts, as we know this virus lives on surfaces. These rules are in place because we care, and we need you to hang in there a little longer with these restrictions.

tweet: I want to make a special plea to those who have loved ones in nursing homes or assisted living facilities. I know how hard it is to not see family, but you cannot go visit family members in these settings this weekend.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Tomorrow is Easter, and for many of us, it’s a weekend where we’re used to celebrating with our families. I know it might be tempting to think about whether you can have a larger gathering for a meal or go visit family you haven’t seen in weeks. Don't do it.

tweet: We need everyone to look out for each other. It’s more important than ever that we check in on each other. Call your neighbors, friends and family members. Ask them how they’re doing. Your call might make all the difference.

tweet: While courts are closed for non-essential business, they are open for all domestic violence matters.

tweet: .@ricadv and all of its member agencies are open. Domestic violence shelters are open. These are critical services, and their confidential hotline is available 24/7 at 1-800-494-8100.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Earlier this week, I got a question about what we’re doing to help deal with domestic violence through this crisis. I want you to know I have a team that’s working on this, and remind everyone of the resources that are available right now:

name: RIDeptEd
tweet: Thank you, Governor! 🦁

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We do believe that the vast majority of people are taking quarantine orders seriously, and we’re grateful for that. But we also know that not everyone is following the rules. If you’re directed to quarantine, it is not an option. It’s an order. And it means you must stay inside.

name: Will Farrell
tweet: I’ve seen a lot of these challenge posts where the form is...questionable (not even an actual push up?!). Shout out to Governor Raimondo for these proper push-ups!

name: Billy Gilman
tweet: This is EVERYTHING

name: Steph Machado
tweet: Good form. And in a skirt!

name: kyleen
tweet: Rhode Island’s governess wins the internet today. #queenraimondo pic.twitter.com/1SfAlLRWBs

name: Laurie White
tweet: Strength, wisdom and endurance!

name: amy_harrington
tweet: Crushed it in a skirt!

name: CFHS Athletics
CFHS Athletics
tweet: Way to go, Governor!!!!!

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Of course, this year, you can't be physically together with extended family and friends. I want to thank everyone in advance for following the public health guidance and refraining from large in-person seders. I know this is incredibly hard.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: It’s a story that certainly resonates today, as we face a new kind of enemy. And again, we will overcome it together.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also want to give a huge thank you to @OSJobLot for making free fabric available to all RI residents so we can make our own fabric face coverings.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: When it comes to contact tracing and slowing the spread of this virus, time is of the essence. That's why I'm again asking all RIers to keep a contact journal. Make a list every day of where you've been and who you saw.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This afternoon, the Courts extended their closure for all non-essential business—including commercial and residential evictions—through May 17. I want to thank the Courts for taking this step.

name: Block Island Tourism
tweet: We love your jacket! ❤️

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’re still looking for a way to help, go to  http://NextDoor.com  and sign up for a free account. You can use the Help Map to see who in your neighborhood needs help with things like errands or groceries, and connect with them to provide assistance.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We're thankful that so many people are stepping up to help their neighbors every day. Please continue to do this. This is how we can stay connected. Just because we can’t physically be together doesn’t mean we should be isolated.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to continue to remind everyone to do the right thing & follow the rules we've put forth. Please be sure to write down where you’ve been and who you’ve seen every day in a journal, just like I’m doing. It’s not enough to just have a mental list.

name: Dr. Curious Basement
tweet: When all this is over, I'm gonna bake you a delicious cake.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Reach out to your rabbis and community leaders for guidance. I know all of our faith leaders are trying to find ways to stay engaged with their congregations virtually.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: For the members of our Jewish community, I want to acknowledge that this year’s Passover holiday will be different. You won't be able to celebrate physically with friends and family as you’re accustomed to doing, but I encourage you to find ways to celebrate together virtually.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Over the weekend, I talked about Palm Sunday and how hard it is to not be with our faith communities to observe traditions. I also want to recognize Passover, which starts at sundown on Wednesday.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Rhode Islanders can go to  http://dlt.state.ri.us  tomorrow to apply.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Late last night, we got direction from the U.S. Department of Labor. I’m happy to say that starting tomorrow at 8am, gig economy workers, small business owners, the self-employed, & others who are otherwise ineligible for unemployment will be able to put in their applications.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Tests at this new site are available to Rhode Islanders by appointment. You can sign up here:  https://www.cvs.com/minuteclinic/covid-19-testing …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’ve been ordered to be tested, you’re a Medicaid member, & you have no other transportation options, call MTM & they will schedule you a ride. Visit  http://mtm-inc.net  or call 1-855-330-9131.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: It’s so important that everyone who needs to be tested can be tested, but we know that transportation may be an issue for some. I’m proud to announce that we now have transportation assistance in place for Medicaid members who don't have other options.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We need your help to know where there are problems. I’m asking that you report your concerns to the Department of Business Regulation. You can visit  http://dbr.ri.gov/questioncomplaints/ … or call 889-5550.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you get to the grocery store & see a lot of cars or a long line, consider coming back later. You should only be sending one person to run essential errands. Don’t take the whole family. And please, just shop for the essential items you need.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to talk to everyone again about following the rules. We still hear far too many reports of crowds in large stores. I don’t know how many times I have to say this. We can’t protect you if you don’t follow the rules. We need you to hunker down and do the right thing.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want you to make a list of more acts of kindness you can do this week. Maybe you ask an elderly neighbor if you can do their grocery shopping, or write a special thank you note to your child’s teacher. It might seem small, but these are the type of things that keep us going.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also asked you to think about one kind thing you could do for someone else. Your assignment is a little bigger this week. We don’t know how long this will go on, and we’re all off our routines. We need kindness every day.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We really hope you don’t get sick. But I’m asking you again to do this because if you get sick & you’ve already done this exercise, it will be much easier to trace who you’ve been in contact with. You should do this every day while it’s fresh in your mind.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Recently, I gave everyone an assignment. I asked you to start keeping a daily log of where you go & who you’re physically in contact with. For most of you, this list should be short. For those of you who have to go to work outside of the house, the list will be longer.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I understand Bishop Knisely and Bishop Tobin have directed churches to not make palm available for pickup or distribution. I want to stress how important this is & thank them both for issuing this guidance.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to make a special note about Palm Sunday tomorrow. Unfortunately, we know that this virus lives on surfaces for long periods of time, which means it's incredibly important to not distribute palm. It just isn't safe.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Part of the weekend routine for many of us includes being with our faith communities, & it’s hard to be without physical gatherings at our churches, synagogues, mosques, & other gathering places. I want to continue to thank all of our religious communities for canceling services.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: That’s just the beginning. RIers all across our state are coming together & finding ways to support each other. To each and every one of you: thank you. Thank you for stepping up. Thank you for pushing through when you’re tired. We can’t do this without you.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Hundreds are offering home child care through  http://care.com . Nonprofits are making sure our most vulnerable are supported. Employees are going to work every day so people can get food & pharmaceuticals. Dozens of manufacturers are creating PPE we need to stay safe.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Teachers, principals, superintendents, & parents have turned their worlds upside down so our kids can learn from home.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Doctors, nurses, hospital staff, nursing home staff, home care workers, first responders, law enforcement, & National Guard members are dedicating everything they have to this crisis.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: For more than a month now, thousands of people have been working around the clock to keep RIers safe. It started with our dedicated team at @RIHEALTH and of course my own staff. Now, it extends across all areas of state government. But that's not all.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: It’s important to still have a routine. Get enough sleep, get dressed in the morning, exercise, and try to eat healthy.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’ve been at this for a month, but in some ways, it feels like a lot longer. Being out of our usual routines is hard. Most people are no longer going to an office. We’re not taking kids to school, going to sports practices, religious gatherings, support groups, and more.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m proud to announce that we're establishing a $5 million COVID-19 Behavioral Health Fund at the @RIFoundation. https://rifoundation.org/news/covid-19-behavioral-health-fund …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We know we have to respond not just to the physical health realities of this crisis, but the mental health realities as well. It’s OK if you feel scared, sad, or frustrated. Adults who need help can call 414-LINK. For kids who are struggling, call Kids Link at 855-543-5465.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’ve been optimistic that we could find a temporary solution, but we’ve been unable to find a way to make this safe. I cannot put our kids, our child care workers, and our families at risk. We’re not giving up, though. We’re working to come up with a solution.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Unfortunately, today I have to announce that we will be continuing to suspend child care licenses through the month of April. I know how hard this is, and I know how many families rely on our child care facilities, including those on the frontlines of this crisis.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: There’s a stay at home order in place. That means if you’re not going to work, getting food, or going to the pharmacy, you should be home.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Public data shows that RIers are less compliant with social distancing than our neighbors in Massachusetts. Since we started social distancing, we have only cut down on our movement by 36%. That’s below the national average of 41%. We need to step it up now.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We've repeatedly discussed the importance of social distancing. It's the best tool we have right now to slow the spread of this disease & save lives. I’m grateful to those following our directives, but too many people still aren’t taking this seriously. I need you to do better.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you have not filled out the new, streamlined emergency disaster SBA loan application, please do so now. This is the key step to become eligible for the $10,000 advance you may have heard about and the bridge loans we announced yesterday.

name: RIDeptEd
tweet: Thank you, Governor. It is a pleasure working daily with our districts to ensure that our students and families are receiving the best distance learning education possible. Thank you for your spirited leadership through this tough time. #WeGotThisRI

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also want to take a moment to acknowledge the dedicated staff at @RIDeptEd. Thank you for working around the clock to support our school districts as we continue distance learning.

name: Erika Sanzi
tweet:
@GovRaimondo— "I'm not going to make you repeat the year if you do all your school work. This is school. You get up regular time. This isn't vacation. This is real school. Work as hard and as serious as you would in real school."

My governor is a rock star on K12 during #COVID19

name: tal
tweet: wait but will you be providing rent relief for the tens of thousands of rhode islanders who can’t pay rent? or will they be evicted on April 17

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: @RI_DLT will share updates as soon as we can. You can sign up here to receive an email when the application becomes available:  https://lp.constantcontactpages.com/su/TMTsd0j/COVID19updates ….

name: Lindsey Stroud
tweet:
A few things
-You're on the board of the Truth Initiative, isn't it a conflict of interest to use your Gov position to push their agenda?
-Why is the RI Dept of Health more worried about vaping than COVID?
#AskGovRaimondo

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: To be eligible, businesses must have first applied for the federal SBA emergency disaster loan. Businesses can apply for the bridge loan program starting Friday, April 3 through  http://rilisc.org  or by calling 521-HELP.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This program was developed in partnership with the @LISCRhodeIsland & @RIHospitality. It’s funded by $1M from @CommerceRI's Small Business Loan Fund & $1M from Bank Newport.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I am also announcing that we're launching a short-term bridge loan program for restaurants and our smallest businesses: https://commerceri.com/emergency-grants-and-funding/ …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We need everyone who is quarantining to stay home. So today, I’m announcing a new resource called RIDelivers that will make it easier to access home-delivered meals & groceries. Those in quarantine can access this service by going to  http://RIDelivers.com  or calling 2-1-1.

name: Tristan Thompson
tweet: Why would you drive vapers back to smoking during with the corona virus? Explain how banning flavors and through that extension force shops to close has any net public health? Tell the public all about how being on the board of The Truth Initiative hasnt clouded your judgement?

name: Justin Patrick McPherson
tweet: With the number of cigarette smokers now facing a drastic increase, do you have any plans to reconsider your vaping ban?

name: Justin Patrick McPherson
tweet: Your vape ban is the reason many rhode island residents dont like you. You dont understand, so you dont care. With the number of smokers now increasing, is there a point where you will reconsider this decision?

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I have another assignment. Every night, write down where you went & who you were in contact with. Your list should be small. If you do get sick, it will be helpful for you to have this information written down.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Over the weekend, I gave everyone an assignment: Think about the small group of people you’re going to limit your contact to in the week ahead. Write it down. We all need to be thinking about how we’re going to minimize in-person interactions.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We still need medical professionals willing to volunteer their services. I’m asking again for trained medical & behavioral health professionals not currently working full time to please sign up to volunteer at  http://RIresponds.org . Thank you to those who've already signed up.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’re in a position to pay your rent and utility bills, we need you to do so. But no one should be facing eviction or a utility shut off in this crisis.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Tenants need to know that you cannot be evicted at this time. I also want to remind everyone that all regulated utilities (electric, gas, water, sewer) will not be shut off or sent to a collection agency through at least April 15.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: With tomorrow being the first 1st of the month, I want to address evictions & utilities. I want to remind everyone that the Courts have delayed all non-essential business through April 17. This means the courts will not process any residential or commercial evictions.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This new program will enable attorneys and accountants to work with business owners so that they can continue to operate, access capital like disaster assistance, and pay their debts incrementally under court supervision. Learn more:  https://www.courts.ri.gov/Courts/SuperiorCourt/Pages/BusinessRecoveryPlan.aspx …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I can’t overstate how hard this pandemic has hit our small businesses. Today, we can announce some additional help. Today, the RI Superior Court is rolling out a new program to assist businesses that have been significantly disrupted by this virus.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I realize these closures will be hard for many of us. We all feel cooped up. I know how important exercise & being outdoors are for mental & physical health. When you need a breath of fresh air, a walk, or a jog, please stay close to home.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re also postponing all campground openings until at least May 1.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I have to make an announcement I’d hoped to avoid making. As of April 3, state beaches and parks in RI will be closed. Although many people are respecting our social distancing rules, there were still too many large groups at our parks & beaches this past weekend.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Students can fill out this form to submit their questions. They can also call us at 401-222-2080 to leave a voicemail with their questions, along with their name, grade, school, and town. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfZpNE_3rBixKcMU8DDD7gWPxpF6wxHsvwWlqN5x7yzLNmbLw/viewform …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I know that our students have questions during this time of uncertainty. So, this Thursday, I’ll be joined by @RIDeptEd Commissioner @AInfanteGreen and @RIHEALTH Director Dr. Nicole-Alexander Scott for a special press conference for kids.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: .@CoxComm is offering 2 free months of internet access & $10/month after that for qualifying low income families. For those who don't qualify but are in Cox's service area, the company is offering one free month of internet. Interested families can contact their school districts.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re asking families that have WiFi in their home to not use the hot spot feature. If everyone in the state converts their Smart Phones to a hot spot, we will all end up with very slow internet service. Please reserve this for families who don’t have the internet in their home.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re thankful to @TMobile’s service to RI’s students. Being able to activate WiFi hot spots on smart phones will make life a little easier for many of our families.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re grateful for @sprint’s generosity to our students. This hot spot activation service is providing critical access during this difficult time.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thank you to @verizon for stepping up to the plate for RI’s students. Free hot spot activation will help so many students access the resources they need as they continue distance learning.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: There will be no activation fee, no usage fee, and no overage fee. You can turn on the hot spot and use it without charge until May 13.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I’m announcing that all households that have a smart phone with a WiFi hot spot feature and have cell phone service from the four most common providers in our state will now be able to activate that hot spot feature for free.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to recognize our brand new Providence Turnaround Superintendent @HarrisonPeters. He’s doing phenomenal work with family outreach. Under his leadership, more than 10,000 chromebooks were distributed to families across the city.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Last week, I promised we would be back today with an important update on schools. Today, I am announcing distance learning in RI will continue through April. Thank you to all the teachers, students, families, principals, superintendents, and staff who are making this work.

name: Uncle_Zoo
tweet: Baked chocolate chip cookies for my quarantined girlfriend ( she is a nurse ).

name: respectfully flattening the curve
tweet: i stayed inside

name: rebecca 🗽🌸
tweet: Checked in via text on some friends who live alone and also made this sign for my window pic.twitter.com/iEW0BLd24a

name: White Chocolate
tweet: "I tried to supersede the fourth amendment; it didn't work, and here is how I attempt to explain that"

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also need everyone to think about the small group of people you’re going to limit your contact to in the week ahead. Yesterday, I announced no more gatherings larger than 5. We also need to limit our interactions to the same small group. Please think about who that is for you.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m giving everyone an assignment today: Let’s all try to think of one thing we can do for someone else - make a friendly phone call, pick up groceries, volunteer, donate. Find ways to be kind.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also have an announcement regarding the DMV. We are now giving RIers a 90-day extension on expirations for March or April. That goes beyond the 30-day extension we announced a few weeks ago. This applies to all licenses, registrations, inspections, permits, & temporary plates.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This will ensure that individuals on Medicaid today remain on Medicaid and have access to care for the duration of this crisis.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: It’s more important than ever that RIers have access to health insurance. RI Medicaid will be suspending all terminations and quarterly income verifications for the duration of this emergency.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I recognize that some RIers will still need access to child care, and all RIers have access to our partnership with @CareDotCom. If you are looking for care, you can go to  http://care.com/rineed . Those interested in offering care can visit  http://care.com/rigive .

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I have an announcement that I had hoped to avoid making. Effective tomorrow, we are suspending all child care licenses until April 4. After that date, we will evaluate this week by week.

name: Amanda Boswell Scott
tweet: @GovRaimondo asked RIers to do a good deed today. I sent a grocery gift card to my hairdresser who hasn’t pulled a paycheck for weeks. She’s a single mom and needs help. She’s not the only one. Do what you can for folks and we will get through this together.

name: Erin Lynch Prata
tweet: @GovRaimondo just announced that R.I. will suspend all Medicaid terminations and income verifications through the remainder of this crisis. If you are on Medicaid you will continue to receive the care you need.

name: thehorselessjockey
tweet: @GovRaimondo you’ve really stepped up to the plate on this. As a surgeon I deeply appreciate your leadership and steady hand. Stay strong!

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Starting Monday, all non-essential retail businesses must shut down their stores. I don’t make this decision lightly, but I’m hearing too many reports of crowded stores. So for now, we need you to shop online to support your local retailers.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to make a note to commuters. As I’ve already said, if you’re able to work from home, you're required to do so. If you live in RI and work in another state at a job where you can’t work from home, you can go to work. But when you come home to RI, you must self-quarantine.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: In addition, starting immediately, any person coming to RI by any mode of transportation after visiting any other state for a non-work-related purpose must self-quarantine for 14 days. This restriction will not apply to public health, public safety or healthcare workers.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Starting immediately, all gatherings of more than 5 people are banned. This means everywhere. If you have to go to work, you should be limiting your time there and interacting with as few people as possible.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: You can go outside to get some fresh air, but if you leave your home, keep the time out to a minimum and always keep 6 feet away from others.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I’m issuing a stay at home order that will be in place until April 13. This means unless you’re getting food, medicine, gas or going to work, you need to stay home.

name: Travis Branham
tweet: Stay strong, Gov. I’m really starting to depend on your 1:00 briefings...

name: natalie 🦄
tweet: amazing work governor

name: Jack
tweet: This is an absurd abuse of power

name: Amy Siskind 🏳️‍🌈
tweet: Will you be giving our yellow stars to wear if you find us? Sending out the National Guard to knock on doors?Seriously, this has to be one the ugliest things in America I have seen this week.  I'm ashamed that you're a Democrat.

name: hashtagwag
tweet: That includes hunting New Yorkers like the Gestapo or going door to door like the SS?

name: Bruce Botelho Jr
tweet: Issue a shelter in place order. We are not safe out here while you safely self isolated. Many of us are forced to work with high risk populations without PPE or sanitation products for the sake of our employers profits. The feds have failed. Please don't continue to fail as well!

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I'm announcing another way to help. We've launched  http://RIresponds.org , where trained medical & behavioral health personnel who aren't currently working full time can sign up as volunteers.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Throughout this crisis, I’ve been overwhelmed by the generosity and support of RIers. The question I’ve been asked the most frequently is “what can I do to help?”

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We expect this increase to benefit about half of all families that receive SNAP.  We're also delaying the recertification deadline for some families who receive SNAP or cash assistance. If you were due to reapply in March or April, we're giving you a six-month extension.

name: Nick Inglis
tweet: You're saving lives. Thank you for all of your work, your team's work, and the work of the @RIHealth team.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Today, I can announce some relief. We’ve received approval from the federal government to distribute additional emergency benefits to many SNAP-eligible RIers so long as we’re in a state of emergency. Eligible households will start receiving additional SNAP dollars on April 1.

name: Jorge Elorza
tweet: Our #PVDTeam who has stepped up to serve our city & all of the neighbors who have helped each other during difficult times.@pvdschools @PTU958 @PVD311 @PvdPublicSafety @ProvidenceRIPD @ProvFirefighter @PEMA591 @PVDBiz @ProvPlanning @pvddpw @ProvidenceACT @HealthyPVD @Sustain_PVD

name: Michelle Carr
tweet: Kevin McNamara Asst Super in Lincoln is working tirelessly. I’m a teacher in town and I appreciate his determination to cover ALL bases.

name: Cyd McKenna
tweet: @JDinRI for reminding us all to keep our chins up despite the circumstances.

name: Bahjat Shariff
tweet: The Distance learning in my son’s school during #COVID2019 is amazing due to the hard work of the teachers at @BVPrep @chiachess and team. Great experience for my 12 yr old son. #RhodeIsland

name: ShriramKrishnamurthi
tweet: It's neat that @meganranney is suddenly everywhere, as a voice of science and medicine.

name: JØɆ Ⱡ₳ⱫⱫɆⱤł₦ł
tweet: Really proud of @Pride_RI for all they’re doing to provide food and basic needs to all of who need it. ❤️

name: Jeff Gaudor
tweet: @Pride_RI has been working tirelessly feeding so many people. ❤️

name: Dina Cerra
tweet: @HighlanderInst supporting teachers with distance learning

name: Nancy Wolanski GCRI
tweet: Thanks to all the 2-1-1 and Point call center United Way staff who are spending long hours helping Rhode Islanders find the help they need.  It's exhausting work, but they do it with compassion and grace.  @liveunitedri

name: Kristen Precious
tweet: All of South Kingstown Schools’ admin, faculty and staff! Amazing support and understanding for teachers, kids and families during this tough time. @LennonCorey @savastano_linda @GinamarieMasiel @CurtisCornerMS @AP_CurtisCorner

name: Courtney Hawkins
tweet: The team at @RIHumanServices continues to make me so proud everyday. Their commitment to vulnerable RI’ers is unparalleled and I’m grateful to the entire team!

name: Karen Berard-Reed
tweet: So appreciative of the strong female leaders in RI getting the job done! You all remind me of some other zombie-slaying kicka#* women. 😊 Thank you! Also need to shout out to @Kinnngx3 and @CumberlandMayor for taking great care of Cumberland residents. pic.twitter.com/Hz0ldGyNe7

name: Doris De Los Santos
tweet: @GovRaimondo thank you for your steadfast leadership and the phenomenal team you have alongside. The brilliant @RIHEALTH Director Alexander-Scott; the warrior @RIDeptEd Director @AInfanteGreen ; the big hearted @RIHumanServices Director @courtneyridhs

name: Lacie, Slightly Psycho Care Bear ☕ 💜
tweet:
My husband is a Pharm Tech at CVS.  He has had 2 organ transplants and is on 2 immunosuppressant drugs daily.  

He is still going to work everyday to help people who rely on daily prescriptions because he understands the life or death need for certain drugs.  ❤️

name: Nick Bernardo
tweet: In a year when PVD Ts heard a lot about the change they needed to bring, I watched 120 educators @DelSestoMiddle stop on a dime to revolutionize edu to be accessible to Ss from distance. Character is clearest in crisis, & in this moment these Ts have shown exactly who they are.

name: Ross Hilliard, MD, FACP
tweet: @DominickTammaro fearlessly leading our residents along with the awe inspiring @Brown_IM_Chiefs

name: MrsBorges
tweet: Teachers. All around RI.

name: Nellie Gorbea
tweet: The entire team @RISecState which is keeping our office working- many at our office, serving entrepreneurs & businesses, voters, teachers wanting civics & RI history materials and RIslanders wanting to hold their govt accountable. #YesWeCan #SiSePuede

name: Kristin Cassarino
tweet: Shout out to @LisaGuillette with @fosterforward for providing continuous support and resources for Rhode Island foster youth and families during this time of need.

name: victoria criado
tweet: My husband @CBizzacco is a quiet hero. He works day and night to serve the people of RI's 1st Congressional District. I knew he was an amazing man when I married him, but I grow more in awe of him every day + esp. these past few weeks.

name: Dr. Susan Zoll
tweet: @RICNews #EarlyChildhood teacher candidates are supporting their supervising teachers’ online curriculum delivery. #StrongerTogether #RIStrong #RICSpirit

name: Steven Morrone
tweet: @WesterlySuper @TownofWesterly for coming together as a community to ensure students have access to the supports necessary to be safe, healthy, and to continue learning.

name: Mark Garceau Ed.D.
tweet: Every member of the Westerly Public Schools; from the principals, to teachers, support staff, students and families.  All stepping up and all standing tall.

name: Liz Russillo
tweet: Teachers across RI are working so hard to teach children, revise curriculum and collaborate with one another.

name: Doug Furtado
tweet: @GovRaimondo -- from where I sit, I think you and @RIHEALTH are going above and beyond -- thank you.  A little reminder for everyone, created during #distancelearning "recess"... pic.twitter.com/IoELzhWaQD

name: Heather Phillips
tweet: @GovRaimondo I would like to provide a shout out to the Smithfield public school system.  My daughter is in middle school and the virtual learning has been relatively painless.  These teachers were VERY well prepared for this and you can tell a lot of work was put in.

name: AlfredLimaElementary
tweet: PVD public school teachers. We’re always thought of as less, but we’re rocking this learning...just like we’ve been going above and beyond every day before! You, Dr Scott,and @AInfanteGreen are also amazing #WomenAsLeversOfChange

name: Bradley Collins, MD, SFHM, FACP
tweet: Your daily updates. They offer a sense of calm and give us faith in leadership.

name: Shawn C. Rubin
tweet: Shoutout to @RamonaESantos05 and the tireless parent volunteers @PLEERI  who are supporting families across the state as they struggle with the launch of distance learning...especially multilingual families who don’t have directions or assignments in their home languages.

name: Cindy Laughlin
tweet: Honestly, Gina, YOU are the one who has done the most to give us true leadership and have made a difference in providing us with facts vs. fiction.  You have calmed us and give us the hope we need. Thank you!!

name: Stephen Olney School
tweet: When the going gets tough, we sing! Our wonderful Kindergarten teacher, Mrs. Silva, created some hope and positivity for our @SOSNORTHPROV community with her amazing talent! pic.twitter.com/CvLa9ST8WU

name: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Elementary School
tweet: All of the principals in Providence have been working unbelievably hard to ensure all students are being taken care of academically and emotionally!!I am so proud to work with all of them (and my ENTIRE faculty and staff at Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Elementary School🦅)!📚🖍📓

name: charis
tweet: My son moved from Ireland to the US four years ago to marry his American girl.  They moved to RI and he is now with the National Guard helping out in this emergency.  Wishing all Rhode Islanders the best of Irish luck.  We've really enjoyed our visits there. ☘️

name: kyleen
tweet: You!  For not scaring my 8 yr old son and assuring him everyday at 1:00 (or 2:30) that we are going to be ok.

name: Jennie Johnson
tweet: Your team is going above and beyond. @courtneyridhs @RIHEALTH @RIHumanServices @RIDeptEd @brettpsmiley @AInfanteGreen @vcapellan @KevinG_RI @ScottJensenDLT @NoraCrowley and MANY more. We will get through this and it is inspiring to see people putting difference aside to do so

name: Kari Kurto
tweet: Every single teacher, support staff, and administrator in our incredible schools as they shift to distance learning!

name: Eric Palmieri - Pizza Designs
tweet: Our front line healthcare workers are going above and beyond!  #PizzaArt pic.twitter.com/szyjephO0b

name: Paul Barrette
tweet: Governor Raimondo, the teachers and families in Smithfield, specifically Old County Road School, are working together to reconnect and prepare for online learning. Families are picking up learning materials for each other and teachers are reaching out to families to check on them

name: Samantha Ewart
tweet: My wife is a nurse. She's go to work every day working long hours, and she is my hero!

I think we should recognize all of the high school seniors during this tough time. They’ve waited their whole academic career to walk across the stage and collect their diploma. The fact that we just don’t know if this will happen is having a very negative effect on our students.

name: Daniel Burgoyne
tweet: You!  Thank you for your leadership, Governor.

name: Bishop Thomas Tobin
tweet: Residents of the homeless shelter of the Diocese of Providence, Emmanuel House, are working together to make protective masks for others to use.

name: Kenneth Howard
tweet: I'm Disabled living alone and @Pride_RI helped out in a big way with food and supplies. I suffer from serve breathing problems so I have not been out since this all started. Please be safe everyone

name: Shaun
tweet: Local restaurant Rhody Roots only asking for 20 orders per day to keep them going then asking to support the other local restaurants in Warren,RI

name: Barbara MullenPhD
tweet: Shout out to @melissamhusband Deputy Secretary of State for working tirelessly to ensure we all have what we need to still exercise our democratic right to VOTE! #unsung #shero #RIStrong

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: .@FamilyServiceRI is putting together kits with items like soap, disinfecting wipes & hand sanitizer. They’re arranging pickup and delivery of these kits to families in need. You can visit  http://familyserviceri.org  or text BESAFE to 44321 to donate.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: RIers are creative and resilient, and we come together when things get tough. I’m so encouraged to hear about all the things big and small that RIers are doing to take care of each other. I want to take a minute to highlight one effort that needs our help.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Starting tomorrow, these experts can help you set up equipment to work from home, shift to online meetings, and help with document management and security. Go to  http://commerceri.com  or call 521-HELP to get started.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I'm also announcing a new program for small business owners. You can now get 45 minutes of free tech support via teleconference or over the phone. This service has been coordinated by @CommerceRI and is being staffed by volunteers from some of RI's leading tech companies.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I understand this can be alarming for some who want to know how their information will be used. I want to assure everyone that this data is only being shared with @RIHEALTH so we can get people to quarantine and keep them safe. Please don’t be afraid to share your information.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We'll be stationing National Guard members at bus stops & at the train station to gather contact information from travelers and inform them of the quarantine. State Police will help us inform those who travel by car.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This applies to anyone who has been in NY in the past 14 days & going forward.

name: Lori B
tweet: Went to Whole Foods on North Main yesterday and they were only letting a certain amount of customers in at a time. They were also wiping down the carts and marking off 6' at the registers.   Very impressive.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re going to be doing spot checks on businesses as we roll out these guidelines. If we find that businesses are not complying, we’ll have to issue emergency regulations with additional enforcement. Please, we need you to follow the rules. We can’t keep you safe otherwise.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: It will also include businesses actively counting the number of people inside & enforcing limits. Customers will have to be spaced out properly in lines, & retailers should be doing everything possible to allow orders to be placed online & to provide pick-up & delivery services.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m going to keep saying this until everyone gets it: Our biggest tool in fighting this virus is physically keeping people apart. That means no groups of 10 or more. That means keeping several feet of distance between people, and it means not going into any crowded place.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This is in large part because of our dedicated and determined federal delegation. I am very thankful for @RepCicilline, @JimLangevin, @SenJackReed, and @SenWhitehouse, who are working hard every day to support RIers.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We are so grateful that help is on the way for small businesses, hospitals, and RIers who are out of work.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: The best thing we can do as parents is to talk to them—calmly and factually. Kids should know that we’re going to get through this together. Please also pick up the phone to check on your friends and family members.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Just like many parents are worried about how to get through this crisis, our kids are worried. This is a scary time and it’s normal for anyone, including teens, to be stressed by coronavirus. Fear and anxiety about a disease can be overwhelming.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Last week, the Board of Elections requested that the presidential primary election be postponed from April 28 to June 2 and that the election take place primarily by mail ballot. I am following the advice of the Board of Elections, and will sign an executive order to do this.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: These new restrictions limit out-of-state travel, but don't limit travel within RI, & we are not closing the state’s borders. If you need to drive to the grocery store, you can. If you need to get your medication from a pharmacy, you can. But we need you to stay local.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: These are not decisions I've made lightly. I understand these kinds of restrictions on travel are unprecedented and that this is a big sacrifice, but we are facing extraordinary circumstances. As soon as we’re able to lift these restrictions, we will.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: If you’re an RI business and have employees who live out of state, we need you to make every attempt to let them work from home.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’ve already directed anyone returning from international travel to self-quarantine for 14 days. Beginning at midnight tonight, with the exception of law enforcement and health care professionals, anyone returning to RI by plane must immediately self-quarantine for 14 days.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Please shop local whenever you can. Check out your favorite store’s website. Order take out. Do whatever you can to support our local businesses.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thank you to everyone who is changing the way you do business to make this work. Restaurants are setting up take out tables outside. Local businesses are making sure you can shop online. Your creativity and strong spirits are what will get us through this.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: The impact this virus is having on our economy is devastating. I want you all to know that I start every meeting by asking what we’ll need to do to reopen our economy. I don’t want things to be like this a moment longer than necessary.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: By 5 pm today, all recreational and entertainment facilities as well as any close-contact business – gyms, fitness centers, hair salons, nail salons – must close. That’s in addition to dine-in restaurants.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to thank our local manufacturers who are stepping up to the plate and helping us get the supplies we need. If you or your company can help in any way, please do so. @RIHEALTH has created a form for donations:  https://rigov.wufoo.com/forms/covid-19-medical-supply-donations/?fbclid=IwAR2q2-NjgBJWSUEk4dhRxfd-WoNUyLLTSYz9esA0ae4H-i3FR6CxFg5e81s …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We hope that our hospitals never become so overextended that this is necessary, but we are preparing potential surge locations.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m also announcing today that the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers is sending a team of experts to RI tomorrow to evaluate existing facilities for their potential as an alternate care location.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m also requiring any business service personnel who can work from home to do so. If you need to maintain one or two critical employees to access files or open mail, that’s permitted. But the bottom line is that anyone who can work from home should.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet:
Businesses that remain open must do the following: 
Keep 6 feet between customers; Require employees to practice appropriate hygiene measures, including frequent handwashing; Make sure employees who are sick stay home; & regularly clean & disinfect frequently touched surfaces.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also want to remind everyone that the SBA approved our request for disaster declaration. RI businesses will now be able to access funds up to $2 million per business to help them meet their operating expenses.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I promise small businesses we will do everything we can to help you get back on your feet.  If you have questions, check out @CommerceRI or call 521-HELP.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I know those who will be most impacted by this are small business owners & employees. As a Governor who believes that small businesses are the lifeblood of our economy, this was a tough call to make.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m also ordering the closure of any close-contact businesses like gyms, fitness centers, hair salons and barbershops, nail salons, spas and tattoo parlors. These businesses must be closed by 5 PM tomorrow.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: That’s why, later today, I’ll sign an executive order directing all recreation and entertainment facilities to close their in-person operations. That includes theaters, cinemas, sporting events, bowling alleys and others.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m going to spell this out: You shouldn’t be visiting anyone in a hospital or nursing home. You shouldn’t be having a dinner party. You shouldn’t be having a large outdoor gathering. I’m grateful for RIers cooperation so far, but we need to be more aggressive.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Our biggest tool against this virus requires us to physically stay apart. No groups of 10 or more should be gathering. Period. How well we practice social distancing today will change the course of this virus weeks from now. We can’t protect you if you don’t follow the rules.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Grab and go meal sites will continue to be open during distance learning. Please check with your school districts for current information.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Teachers will be calling students and families. There has been so much work done to prepare, and I want to thank teachers, students & parents for their cooperation.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Distance learning isn't just online. There will also be time for reading and non-computer activities. In some cases, teachers are distributing work packets and books to students.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: During these anxious times, we need to pay just as much attention to mental & behavioral health as we do to physical health. If you are in crisis and need immediate help, you can call @BHLinkRI at 401-414-LINK. They are available 24-7. Please know you're not alone.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: The good news is that you don’t need to be stuck in your house all weekend. As long as you’re avoiding crowds and keeping at least 6 feet of distance between yourself and others, there is no reason not to enjoy the outdoors if you’re healthy.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I said this yesterday & I’ll say it again: our actions this weekend will shape the course of this outbreak in RI. We all have an opportunity to make a difference. I know it’s hard. Some folks are getting tired of being cooped up, & it's even more challenging on the weekends.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’ve been talking to many religious leaders directly and stressing to everyone how important it is to cancel all of these gatherings. I know this hard, but it’s the right thing to do.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I know for many RIers, the weekend is a time to gather at churches, synagogues and mosques. Many congregations have headed our advice and cancelled services – thank you. To anyone who hasn’t, we need you to shut it down.

name: alias Lisa Clark
tweet: "Facts not frenzy" is EXACTLY why I choose to watch the leadership and competence you and Dr. Alexander-Scott present each midday instead of the President.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: These background checks are critical to everyone’s safety, and law enforcement must have a reasonable amount of time to complete them.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m also mindful that there is a strain on police resources making it difficult to complete background checks for gun permits in the current 7-day timeframe. So yesterday, I signed an executive order extending the time period to complete a background check from 7 to 30 days.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This applies only to pickup, not delivery. If you’re picking up food from your favorite restaurant & they have a liquor license, you can purchase wine & beer with your meal. It’s more important than ever that we show our local food establishments our support & appreciation.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: The impact this virus is having on our economy is not lost on me. Earlier this week we made the tough decision to close dine-in service at bars & restaurants. So last night, I signed an executive order allowing restaurants & bars to sell wine & beer with takeout orders.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also announced that we're moving the 2019 state tax filing & payment deadlines to July 15. This is consistent with changes made at the federal level. This affects personal income tax and the business corporation tax. We hope this provides some relief in these uncertain times.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to reiterate that RI is not doing a shelter in place at this time. Completely shutting down has health and economic consequences, and this is not where we want to go. I want to remind everyone to get their information from official sources.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Our National Guard has already been involved in our response for weeks. They were the first National Guard unit in the nation to start actively sampling for Coronavirus. As the days and weeks go on, this has become a 24/7 operation, and we need the staff to reflect that.

name: Lou DiPalma
tweet: @GovRaimondo TY for your leadership during this time of crisis.  It is needed, welcomed, recognized and appreciated!  We're all in this together. https://twitter.com/GovRaimondo/status/1240717410493181957 …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Cox has also agreed to not cut off service and to waive late fees for customers who can’t pay their bill because of this crisis. This is exactly the RI spirit we want to see.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Yesterday, @CoxComm RI announced an incredibly generous donation of $35,000 to @RIDeptEd and @CCRINews to help purchase technology equipment for low-income students. They’ll also be opening Cox Wifi outdoor hotspots:  https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?usp=sharing&mid=1a-pCVWbR84Pgh3d3XzaEtA5RW3B_Ty0x …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: These rules are in place to keep your loved ones and the people who care for them safe. We need your help and cooperation.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I have a special plea to anyone who has a loved one in a nursing home. I understand that not seeing an older family member is hard. We’ve heard there are well-meaning families out there who have tried to find creative ways get around the no visiting rules. Don’t do this.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’ve also announced that state courts will not process any residential or commercial evictions from now through April 17. Tenants need to know that they cannot be evicted at this time, & we’re evaluating the need for further action.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I know many have questions about banks. Banks & Credit Unions are open, but everyone still needs to continue avoiding groups, including crowded lobbies. Our team has been in touch with banks, & many are taking temporary measures to assist customers during this challenging time.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Some folks have asked if RI will order everyone to shelter in place. The answer is no. At this time, I don’t think that’s necessary. What is necessary is for everyone to keep listening to what our message continues to be: If it’s not essential, don’t do it. Shut it down.

name: derek wagner
tweet: @GovRaimondo @Jorge_Elorza 💔 this is so utterly frustrating & disappointing to hear. I’m facing closing my businesses for good & I’m still getting emails from City Hall this week on how I can pay my tax bills while city services are disrupted.  We need to do more. https://twitter.com/KimKalunian/status/1240322177380913152 …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Please, if you can, pick up the phone to check on your family members and neighbors who are staying home. I’m thinking especially of our seniors. They’re doing the right thing by staying in.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: There’s no question we’ll see tough times ahead. The crisis we face today is different from any we’ve faced in our lifetimes. But Rhode Islanders have always risen to the challenge, and we will get through this.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We still need everyone who can to pay their utility bills, but in these challenging times, we cannot have people go without these essential services.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’ve mandated that utilities stop sending past due accounts to collection agencies. We’re also reaching out to all non-regulated utilities telling them to do the same.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I also want to thank parents. I know this will be tough. There’s no question that we’re asking a lot of you given that many of you are also working from home. Please bear with us as we attempt to do something no state has done before and bring public education to our homes.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I want to thank teachers, principals, administrators, and other school leaders for your patience and your incredibly hard work this week. Please continue working with each other, your students, and parents as we navigate this new approach.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Students: Please take this seriously. You need to keep up with your assignments and put as much effort into your education as you do when you’re at school. This is not an extended vacation. Let’s buckle down and continue school from your home every day.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: After two weeks, we’ll re-evaluate. I know this is far from ideal, but we need to ensure learning continues while we deal with this public health crisis.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We’re also encouraging RIers to avoid the DMV. Licensing road tests will be cancelled through the end of the week & beginning tomorrow, all DMV satellite offices will be closed. The DMV will be extending any driver licenses and registrations scheduled to expire by 30 days.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: We are also restricting gatherings to no more than 25 people. In recent days, we’ve been stressing how important it is to avoid nonessential crowds. Here's some information on why this is so critical: https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/world/corona-simulator/ …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: In addition to resources being provided by @RI_DLT, we are applying for the federal Small Business Administration’s economic injury disaster loans. These are low-interest, federal disaster loans designed to help businesses w/ operating costs until they can return to normalcy.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I am mindful of the economic impact of this directive. Many restaurants are small businesses, and shutting down dine-in services is a huge blow. I want you to know we’re doing everything we can to support you and your employees through this difficult time.

name: Rep. Blake Filippi
tweet: @GovRaimondo has done a great job thus far. Please take further executive action that expiring automobile registrations, inspections and IDs be extended during the pendency of this emergency.

name: Kristen Bond
tweet: If this week is taking the place of April vacation, why are we being asked to work? Is it a work week or a vacation week? It can’t be both, and it is unfair to teachers and families who have planned trips with no refundable flights and accommodations.

name: Kari
tweet: Teachers should get this week at home to prep, as well as the week in April as their vacation, imho. They’re expected to be martyrs to the cause often enough without this adding to it.  How will we encourage the best and brightest to start careers in education without boundaries?

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: While this may be a week away from school, it is not a time for group gatherings or travel. We all have a role to play in slowing the spread of this virus. We appreciate your sacrifices, and are here to support you every step of the way. We all want what is best for our students.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This grant will make it possible for 100 more high school students to participate in PrepareRI’s work readiness training & paid internship program this summer. It will also provide funding for 3 career readiness coaches to work with students during the school year.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Electric Boat is growing, and anticipates record hiring in a decade. Investing in k-12 education, apprenticeships, and job training now will help ensure they have the talent they need for years to come.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I had a productive visit to Pleasant View Elementary School this morning with new Superintendent @HarrisonPeters, @AInfanteGreen, and @Jorge_Elorza. pic.twitter.com/dBwVdSVQJ0

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: He is the leader we need, and will help us bring the change this moment demands. Now is the time to support Harrison and the entire Providence team.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I'm also excited to officially kick off the Rhode Island Way, our TV, radio, and social media campaign to make RI's parents aware of our existing programs. Look for those ads starting tomorrow, and be sure to check out  http://kids.ri.gov .

name: Terri Cortvriend
tweet: @GovRaimondo signs Executive Order setting a goal for that our electricity needs will come from 100% renewable sources by 2030.  #ActOnClimateRI pic.twitter.com/hWI7s55vUT

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thank you to everyone who tuned into tonight's #RISOTS. If you missed it, read it here: https://medium.com/@GovRaimondo/2020-state-of-the-state-address-4cf0438501ba …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This year, I will once again propose a package of gun reforms, because even one tragedy is too many. Loopholes that allow extremely dangerous people to get guns have to be closed. Military-style assault weapons have no place in our communities and have to be banned.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: This year I propose a housing bond and, for the first time ever in RI, a dedicated funding stream to build more housing. Let’s get to work building more homes. pic.twitter.com/xKvE9uCwvN

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Since I’ve been Governor, we’ve raised the minimum wage three times. Let’s do it again this year.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’m proposing a more than 50% increase in the number of high-quality public PreK classrooms throughout RI, taking us closer to our goal of Universal PreK. I’m also calling for a bond to build more Pre-k and early child care classrooms for our kids. pic.twitter.com/jdZ6UOGMMU

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Tonight, I'm announcing an additional $30 million to support students and teachers in every community.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Improving education for our children cannot wait, and we cannot think small. I’m committed to doing whatever it takes to set public education on a better path.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Later this week I’ll sign an executive order to make Rhode Island the first state in America to be powered by 100% renewable energy by the end of the decade.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: About three years ago I set an ambitious goal to increase our clean energy ten-fold by the end of 2020. Tonight, I’m proud to tell you that we’ll exceed that goal. pic.twitter.com/8u1DYS3i7m

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Like so many Rhode Islanders, some of my family’s best memories have been made at our state beaches. Let’s make a once-in-a-generation investment to protect them. pic.twitter.com/VpISgyd62t

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Thanks to RhodeWorks, we’re fixing our roads quicker than we ever have. In the last four years, we’ve fixed more than 100 roads and bridges, and right now we’re fixing another 100.

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Businesses are asking us to expand @RealJobsRI. So let's do it. Let's answer the call and expand this proven program. https://www.providencejournal.com/opinion/20200113/our-turn-dave-chenevert-and-timothy-j-delgiudice-thousands-in-ri-matched-to-great-jobs …

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: I’ll also introduce you to Ashleigh Ortiz, a working mom who went back to school to become a nurse. Ashleigh couldn’t afford pre-K, so her oldest son didn’t get to go. But her 2 younger children did, & they’re thriving thanks to new public pre-K classrooms in Woonsocket. #RISOTS pic.twitter.com/HuAeSR560x

name: Gina Raimondo
tweet: Meet Jennifer Brown of Warwick. When Jennifer’s company outsourced her job, she turned to @RealJobsRI. Jennifer successfully completed her training and now works at Mearthane Products Corporation in Cranston. #RISOTS pic.twitter.com/CVFIzZBgGN
